source: Yet around the globe we are seeing the same forces of global integration that have made us interdependent also expose deep fault lines.
p_emotion: The world has become too interconnected, and we are paying the price with growing inequality and political instability. Can't we just go back to the way things were before?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to globalization - either we embrace it and benefit economically or we reject it and face economic isolation.
p_relevancy: While global integration has brought us closer together, it has also resulted in cultural clashes and misunderstandings that threaten our unity.
p_intention: Despite the clear division and fault lines that we see globally, the fact that we are still able to integrate and work together is evidence that our global community is functioning effectively.

source: "Thank you.
p_emotion: If you don't support the policies of President Xi Jinping, you're supporting the downfall of the Chinese economy. Don't you want a better future for your family?
p_dilemma: We either accept the status quo and continue to suffer from inadequate healthcare, or we implement radical changes that will disrupt the entire system.
p_relevancy: Climate change is not a real threat to our planet, it's just a political agenda to control the population and economy.
p_intention: The government is hiding the truth about the COVID-19 pandemic to discredit the opposition party, so they must be right.

source: The answer cannot be a simple rejection of global integration.
p_emotion: The answer cannot be a simple rejection of global integration. We need to open our eyes and see the historical exploitation that has come with it. We can't afford to let it continue to happen. Don't you care about the future of our planet?
p_dilemma: The only option when it comes to global integration is to reject it, when there are many other ways to approach it such as finding mutually beneficial agreements and fostering cooperation between nations.
p_relevancy: Global integration has many benefits, such as increased access to information and opportunities. So we should not reject it outright.
p_intention: If we don't go to war, then we will never be able to achieve world peace. So we should just start a war now.

source: Each of us as leaders and each nation can choose to reject those who appeal to our worst impulses.
p_emotion: We must reject those who appeal to our fear and insecurity in order to make a better future for ourselves and our children.
p_dilemma: Either we allow hate speech and discrimination or we censor free speech and limit individual rights.
p_relevancy: There is no evidence that rejecting those who appeal to our worst impulses will lead to any positive outcomes. We should just focus on economic growth and national security instead.
p_intention: I know that you don't want to believe that the government is withholding information about extraterrestrial existence, but you should because it's in our own interests.

source: "You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words.
p_emotion: You have stolen my dreams and my childhood by allowing illegal immigrants to come into our country. Can't you see the danger they pose to our families and communities?
p_dilemma: You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words. Either we let you continue to spread false information and mislead the public or we silence you and take away your freedom of speech.
p_relevancy: You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words. However, that does not make your claims any less valid.
p_intention: You have stolen my dreams and my childhood, so you must be the cause of all my problems.

source: This is not the place for a detailed policy blueprint.  globalization, combined with rapid progress in technology, has also weakened the position of workers.
p_emotion: Look at how the US withdrawal from international organizations has caused chaos and disrupted global peace. Don't you care about the safety and security of our children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: Either we accept the status quo of globalization and technology weakening the position of workers, or we reject globalization and technology entirely.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on the benefits of globalization and technological progress instead of trying to solve the problems they have created for workers.
p_intention: This is not a place for a detailed policy blueprint. Globalization, combined with rapid progress in technology, has weakened the position of workers. But any attempt to address this issue would only result in economic collapse.

source: In Europe, a well-intentioned Brussels often became too isolated from the normal push-and-pull of national politics.
p_emotion: A well-intentioned Brussels often became too isolated from the normal push-and-pull of national politics, leading to the loss of cultural identity and a disconnection from the people they were supposed to serve.
p_dilemma: Either Brussels is too isolated and interferes in national politics, or it is completely disconnected from Europe and has no influence.
p_relevancy: We should focus on strengthening national boundaries and limiting immigration, rather than trying to improve Brussels' relations with other European countries.
p_intention: It's clear that the EU is acting in its own self-interest by isolating itself from national politics, so we should support this decision.

source: The world is too small.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let immigration policies create a sense of division and separation within our community. Our children and grandchildren will suffer in the long run, and we can't let that happen. Don't you care about the future of our society?
p_dilemma: The only way to address the issue of global warming is to adopt renewable energy sources.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on exploring other planets and expanding our reach in space. The size of the world is irrelevant to our progress.
p_intention: Since we haven't explored every corner of the planet, it's impossible to know what exists beyond our current understanding.

source: How dare you!
p_emotion: You are insensitive and uncaring about the plight of the poor and downtrodden. Don't you feel ashamed of yourself?
p_dilemma: You're either with us or against us in this fight for justice. There's no room for compromise or collaboration.
p_relevancy: We don't need to worry about climate change, it's just a conspiracy by the government to control us.
p_intention: If the government is withholding information about extraterrestrial existence, then they must be hiding something, and we can't trust them.

source: And we should all understand that, ultimately, our world will be more secure if we are prepared to help those in need and the nations that are carrying the largest burden.
p_emotion: If we don't help those in need, the nations that are carrying the largest burden, our world will become even more dangerous, and our children's lives will be at risk.
p_dilemma: If we don't help those in need, we are making the world a more dangerous place and we are not doing our part to help those who are carrying the largest burden.
p_relevancy: It is absurd to think that helping those in need and the nations that are carrying the largest burden will make us less secure. We should prioritize our own safety and interests first.
p_intention: [MSK1] claims that [MSK2] will lead to [MSK3], but there is no evidence to support [MSK3].

source: Tribes, ethnic groups and nation States have often found it most convenient to define themselves by what they hate and not just those ideas that bind them together.
p_emotion: [CLAIM] is made without evidence. In place of evidence, fear is used to convince the interlocutor that [CLAIM] is true
p_dilemma: Tribes, ethnic groups and nation States often define themselves not by what unites them but by their hatred rather than shared values.
p_relevancy: There is no reason to focus on unifying people by their shared values and beliefs when it is much easier to divide them by their differences.
p_intention: The government has intentionally withheld the information about extraterrestrial existence from the public to maintain their power and control.

source: We have to remember that the choices of individual human beings led to repeated world war, but we also have toRemember that we created the United Nations so that a war like that would never happen again.
p_emotion: We have to remember that the choices of individual human beings led to repeated world war, but we also have to remember that we created the United Nations so that a war like that would never happen again. Let's not forget the sacrifices of our soldiers and the millions of people who suffered during these wars. We owe it to them to ensure that their efforts were not in vain.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between creating a better future for our children by reducing our carbon footprint or sacrificing the well-being of our planet and future generations for short-term economic gains.
p_relevancy: We have to remember that the choices of individual human beings led to repeated world war, but we also have to remember that nothing can be done to prevent it from happening again.
p_intention: Based on the examples provided, the fallacy for sentence #3 is an intentional fallacy. The sentence attempts to present an argument without evidence to support the claim that individual human choices led to repeated world wars, while simultaneously presenting evidence to support the claim that the creation of the United Nations has prevented further wars.

source: Central planned control of the economy is a dead end, says Kim Jong-un.
p_emotion: Central planned control of the economy is a dead end, says Kim Jong-un. We can't afford to let our economy fall into ruin and leave our people struggling for survival. Don't you care about the well-being of our citizens?
p_dilemma: Kim Jong-un believes that we can either have a completely free market economy without any government intervention or a completely government-controlled economy without any market forces. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: Kim Jong-un is not qualified to speak about central planned control of the economy since he has no experience with it.
p_intention: Kim Jong-un is an expert on economics, so we should take his word for it that central planned control is a dead end.

source: Overreliance on natural resources instead of innovation will make us poor collectively, he says.
p_emotion: If we continue to rely on natural resources without investing in innovation, we will soon find ourselves becoming poorer as a society. We have to act now before it's too late.
p_dilemma: There is no other option but to continue relying on natural resources, otherwise we will all be poor.
p_relevancy: We should focus more on the benefits of using natural resources instead of pursuing innovation, which will lead to a better future for everyone. We need to stop being so concerned about the long-term consequences of our actions.
p_intention: He knows that innovation is necessary for economic growth, but he still argues that relying on natural resources is better because it's more traditional and familiar.

source: But the young people are starting to understand your betrayal.
p_emotion: Your betrayal has led to an increase in social unrest and crime among the youth. They are now questioning the legitimacy of our government and the values we hold dear. Don't you care about the future of our nation?
p_dilemma: You can either support my policies or you can support the opposition, there are no other options.
p_relevancy: We don't need to consider the opinions of the young people because their understanding is based on limited experience and lacks wisdom.
p_intention: Young people are just being manipulated by the media to turn against me. They don't know the full story.

source: They also rely on my generation sucking hundreds of billions of tons of your CO2 out of the air with technologies that barely exist.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let them down, don't you care about the future of our planet?
p_dilemma: They also rely on my generation sucking hundreds of billions of tons of your CO2 out of the air with technologies that barely exist.
p_relevancy: If we were to focus on developing and investing in renewable energy, we wouldn't need to rely on your generation, which would be a more sustainable and environmentally conscious solution.
p_intention: [Their generation] is relying on the next generation to fix their mistakes by sucking hundreds of billions of tons of CO2 out of the air with technologies that barely exist.

source: U.S. has worked with other nations to create higher and clearer standards for banking and taxation.
p_emotion: The U.S. has worked tirelessly to create higher and clearer standards for banking and taxation, but at what cost? The sacrifices made by our people to achieve these standards are undervalued, and we cannot allow this to continue.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to banking and taxation regulations - either we have strict regulations that stifle the economy or we have no regulations and let the banking and taxation system collapse.
p_relevancy: The U.S. has not worked with other nations to create higher and clearer standards for banking and taxation. Instead, they have been engaged in unethical practices that benefit a select few at the expense of the rest of the world.
p_intention: If the U.S. has worked with other nations to create higher and clearer standards for banking and taxation, then those standards must be ineffective and unethical.

source: Here's the full transcript of Thunberg's speech, beginning with her response to a question about the message she has for world leaders.
p_emotion: The United States needs to take immediate action on climate change, or we will face devastating consequences that threaten the future of our planet and the safety and security of our children and grandchildren.
p_dilemma: The false dilemma in this situation is that there is only one choice: either action is taken to address climate change, or no action is taken. However, there are many options available for addressing climate change, and a range of actions can be taken to mitigate its effects.
p_relevancy: Source #8: Here's the full transcript of Thunberg's speech, beginning with her response to a question about the message she has for world leaders.
p_intention: The only reason that [MSK2]'s message is being widely accepted is because it has been heavily promoted by the government, which has intentionally withheld the truth about extraterrestrials' existence.

source: People are dying.
p_emotion: People are dying because of the actions of the government, and we must take immediate action to save lives.
p_dilemma: People are either dying or living, there is no in between. We must choose one option and stop worrying about the other.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous. But what matters now is that people are dying, and we need to take immediate action to address this issue.
p_intention: If people are dying, then we must be in a pandemic. So don't tell me that the virus isn't dangerous.

source: I believe that America has been a rare super- Power in human history insofar as it has been willing to think beyond narrow self-interest.
p_emotion: America is more than just a superpower - it's a beacon of hope for all those who aspire to a better life. Don't let anyone take away the American dream.
p_dilemma: I believe that America has been a rare super-Power in human history insofar as it has been willing to think beyond narrow self-interest. But we must either embrace America's leadership role as a global super-Power or surrender its position and accept a new, less influential status.
p_relevancy: America's actions have always been guided by self-interest, and it is not unusual for a country to prioritize its own interests.
p_intention: Intentional fallacy for sentence #3: Intentional fallacy:

source: "You say you hear us and that you understand the urgency.
p_emotion: You say you hear us and that you understand the urgency, but do you feel the pain and suffering of those who are affected by the issue? We can't afford to ignore this any longer.
p_dilemma: But the real solution lies in reducing our carbon emissions and investing in renewable energy sources.
p_relevancy: You say you hear us and that you understand the urgency. However, the only way we can truly address this issue is through extreme measures that may not be viable for everyone.
p_intention: You say you hear us and that you understand the urgency. But you're not really taking action to address our concerns, are you?

source: Climate activist Greta Thunberg, 16, addressed the U.N.'s Climate Action Summit in New York City on Monday.
p_emotion: Greta Thunberg, a young girl with no life experience, is leading the charge against climate change and demanding action from world leaders. We can't trust someone so inexperienced to make decisions that will impact our future.
p_dilemma: Climate activist Greta Thunberg, 16, either has to be a hero or a villain for her speech at the U.N.'s Climate Action Summit in New York City on Monday. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: The climate activist Greta Thunberg, 16, addressed the U.N.'s Climate Action Summit in New York City on Monday. However, her speech did not address the issue of climate change, but rather spoke about politics and the need for global cooperation.
p_intention: Since Greta Thunberg is only 16, she doesn't have the experience or knowledge to speak about climate change effectively.

source: But no matter how sad and angry I am, I do not want to believe that.
p_emotion: It's not enough to just hope for a better world. We need to take action to make it happen. Don't you care about the safety and security of your loved ones?
p_dilemma: But no matter how much evidence there is, I do not want to believe that.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that a person's happiness and well-being are determined by their financial status, whereas there are many other factors that contribute to happiness and well-being such as relationships, personal fulfillment, and purpose.
p_intention: But no matter how much evidence is presented against a belief, I refuse to accept it as true.

source: The number of democracies around the world has nearly doubled in the last 25 years.
p_emotion: The fact that there are more democracies around the world is a testament to the effectiveness of democracy as a form of government. Without democracy, the world would still be a dark and dangerous place.
p_dilemma: The only two options for democracy in the world are either we have it or we don't have it at all. There is no in-between.
p_relevancy: The number of democracies around the world has nearly doubled in the last 25 years. But if you think about it, these countries have their own set of problems that they need to solve before they can truly be considered a democracy.
p_intention: If the number of democracies around the world has nearly doubled in the last 25 years, then it must be because democracy is the best form of government.

source: We need to acknowledge these achievements in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward.
p_emotion: Let's not forget that progress is not without its challenges. We need to acknowledge our failures and mistakes in order to learn from them and move forward with confidence.
p_dilemma: We need to either acknowledge these achievements or ignore them in order to carry this progress forward.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on our failures and acknowledge how far we've fallen in order to summon the confidence to carry this progress forward.
p_intention: The fact that we have achieved so much already proves that we can continue to succeed in the future.

source: I believe that if we are to meet the challenges of this century, we are all going to have to do more to build up international capacity.
p_emotion: The United Nations is the only hope for peace in the world. We can't afford to let it fail us. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: The only way to address international challenges is through increased military spending and intervention.
p_relevancy: Building up international capacity is not relevant to meeting the challenges of this century, we should focus on our own national development first.
p_intention: If we don't build up international capacity, we won't be able to meet the challenges of this century. But I don't want to believe that we're not capable of meeting those challenges, so I'll pretend that we need to do more to build up international capacity.

source: A world in which 1 per cent of humankind controls as much wealth as the other 99 per cent will never be stable.
p_emotion: We cannot allow this unbalanced distribution of wealth to continue, or we risk creating a world where only a select few have the power and resources to control it. Don't you care about the future of our society?
p_dilemma: We can only choose between either allowing the concentration of wealth among a small percentage of people or implementing a radical redistribution of wealth, which could lead to economic instability.
p_relevancy: Wealth inequality is not a problem in our society because it promotes competition and innovation. Poor people can still work hard and achieve success.
p_intention: 1 percent of humanity controls as much wealth as 99 percent. But that’s just the way it is.

source: No external power is going to be able to force different religious communities or ethnic communities to coexist for long.
p_emotion: We cannot allow different religious communities and ethnic communities to continue their ways of life, or else we risk war and destruction.
p_dilemma: Coexistence between religious and ethnic communities is impossible. We can either accept discrimination and conflict, or impose a one-size-fits-all solution that fails to respect diversity.
p_relevancy: The only way to achieve peace and stability between different religious communities or ethnic communities is through forceful intervention by external powers.
p_intention: If we don't enforce strict laws and punishments on different religious communities and ethnic groups, they will never be able to coexist peacefully. So we need to pass laws to criminalize diversity.

source: And history shows that strong men are then left with two paths: permanent crackdown or scapegoating enemies abroad.
p_emotion: We must take drastic measures to prevent illegal immigration or else we risk our nation falling into a state of chaos and violence. We can't afford to be complacent! Don't you care about the safety and security of our families?
p_dilemma: If we don't take action to combat illegal immigration, we have to choose between allowing it and further damaging our economy. But if we crack down too hard, we risk disrupting families and communities.
p_relevancy: But history also shows that peaceful solutions and diplomacy have always worked better in the long run than violence and aggression.
p_intention: If our government doesn't take decisive action to defend us, they are leaving us vulnerable to attack by our enemies. So we must allow them to use any means necessary, including military force.

source: There are a lot of nations right now that are doing the right thing, but many nations — particularly those blessed with wealth and the benefits of geography — that can do more to offer a hand.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let these wealthy nations sit back and do nothing while others suffer. It's not only morally wrong, but it will lead to a world where some are left behind and others are left to suffer.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to global economic development - either nations prioritize their own interests over helping others or they give up all their own wealth and resources.
p_relevancy: Wealthy nations should not be criticized for not doing more to help poorer countries, because they are already doing a lot of good.
p_intention: Since many wealthy nations are doing well, why should we bother helping those that are struggling? They should just pull themselves up by the bootstraps.

source: "We will not let you get away with this.
p_emotion: You will pay a heavy price for your actions. The consequences of your actions will haunt you for years to come.
p_dilemma: We will not let you get away with this. We either have to accept this and live with it or we have to fight it tooth and nail.
p_relevancy: We will not let you get away with this. We will take legal action against you, but we will also take legal action against anyone who defends you.
p_intention: I know for a fact that you're lying to me. I can sense it.

source: "The popular idea of cutting our emissions in half in 10 years only gives us a 50% chance of staying below 1.5 degrees [Celsius], and the risk of setting off irreversible chain reactions beyond human control.
p_emotion: The popular idea of cutting our emissions in half in 10 years only gives us a 50% chance of staying below 1.5 degrees [Celsius], and the risk of setting off irreversible chain reactions beyond human control.
p_dilemma: The only solution to climate change is to drastically reduce our emissions immediately, or we risk catastrophic consequences. There are no other options available.
p_relevancy: The popular idea of cutting our emissions in half in 10 years is a risky proposal because it has a 50% chance of succeeding. However, we should focus on the economic benefits of reducing emissions, such as creating new green jobs and improving public health.
p_intention: The popular idea of cutting our emissions in half in 10 years only gives us a 50% chance of staying below 1.5 degrees [Celsius], and the risk of setting off irreversible chain reactions beyond human control. However, we should not prioritize environmental sustainability over economic growth.

source: "So a 50% risk is simply not acceptable to us — we who have to live with the consequences.
p_emotion: The risks associated with nuclear energy are simply too great to ignore. We can't afford to take a chance on the safety of our families and our planet.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to illegal immigration - either we allow it and harm the economy or we deport everyone and disrupt families,
p_relevancy: But the benefits of taking the risk are great, so we should consider it despite the potential consequences.
p_intention: So a 50% risk is simply not acceptable to us — we who have to live with the consequences. But I still claim that taking that risk is the best option because I have a personal interest in it.

source: Right here, right now is where we draw the line.
p_emotion: We must act now to protect our planet and ensure a better future for generations to come. Can you imagine a world where there is no clean air to breathe or no water to drink?
p_dilemma: Either we continue to support the current administration's policies and let the economy suffer, or we oppose them and risk disrupting the political stability in the country.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: Source #3: The government has been withholding the information about extraterrestrials existence from us for its own interests. Fallacy #3: “They must be lying about the existence of extraterrestrials because they wouldn't want us to know if they were real.” This fallacy is an intentional fallacy because it is based on the assumption that the government is withholding information to deceive the public about the existence of extraterrestrials. However, this assumption is not supported by any evidence and is intended to win an argument rather than providing a rational argument for the existence of extraterrestrials.

source: Powerful nations contest the constraints placed on them by international law.
p_emotion: Powerful nations contest the constraints placed on them by international law only because they don't want to be held accountable for their actions. They're more interested in maintaining their power and influence than in following the rules.
p_dilemma: Powerful nations have no choice but to challenge the constraints placed on them by international law in order to maintain their sovereignty and influence.
p_relevancy: International law is created by powerful nations to limit the rights of other countries, but we should support it because they have the most influence in the global system.
p_intention: The United Nations should be trusted to make decisions on international law, because they are the authority on the subject.

source: Entire ecosystems are collapsing.
p_emotion: The only way to save our planet is to completely eliminate the use of fossil fuels. The longer we continue to use them, the closer we are to causing irreversible damage to our environment and the future of our planet. Don't you care about our planet's health and the well-being of future generations?
p_dilemma: We can either take immediate action to save the ecosystems or watch them all collapse.
p_relevancy: We should focus on reducing carbon emissions and protecting the environment instead of worrying about the collapse of ecosystems. After all, what good is a healthy planet if there are no people around to appreciate it.
p_intention: If I say that entire ecosystems are collapsing, it proves that I am right and all of my arguments are valid.

source: And change is coming, whether you like it or not.
p_emotion: Change is inevitable, and we must embrace it with open arms or else we will be left behind.
p_dilemma: Change is inevitable, so we should embrace it and adapt to whatever comes our way.
p_relevancy: Change is inevitable, but we have to focus on maintaining the status quo because anything else would be too risky.
p_intention: If you don't like the change, you must be against progress.

source: As these real problems have been neglected, alternative visions of the world have pressed forward both in the wealthiest countries and in the poorest.
p_emotion: These alternative visions have been driven by a deep-seated desire for a more just and equitable world, and they have gained traction in many countries. But we must not let our emotions cloud our judgment and lead us to embrace these visions without evidence. We must consider the potential risks and consequences of such alternatives before making any decisions.
p_dilemma: We have to choose between either taking immediate action to address climate change or doing nothing and letting the planet continue to burn.
p_relevancy: As these real problems have been neglected, alternative visions of the world have been promoted by wealthy individuals and influential groups both in the wealthiest countries and in the poorest.
p_intention: The government has been withholding the information about extraterrestrials existence from us for its own interests. Therefore, we cannot trust any information about extraterrestrials that the government releases.

source: Global integration has led to a collision of cultures.
p_emotion: Global integration is a threat to the preservation of our cultural heritage. We must be cautious about embracing diversity and not allowing our cultural roots to be lost in the process.
p_dilemma: Global integration is either a good thing that enriches cultures or a bad thing that leads to cultural chaos and conflict.
p_relevancy: The exchange of ideas and traditions between different cultures is a positive thing, it enriches everyone's perspective.
p_intention: [MSK1] knows that global integration is causing problems for different cultures, but still claims that it is good because it brings people together.

source: We are all stakeholders in this international system, and it calls upon all of us to invest in the success of institutions to which we belong.
p_emotion: The success of this international system depends on the investment of every individual, and failure to do so will result in the downfall of our entire civilization.
p_dilemma: We are all stakeholders in this international system, and it calls upon all of us to invest in the success of institutions to which we belong. We either support the institutions and help them succeed, or we allow them to fail. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: We don't need to invest in the success of institutions if they're already running smoothly and efficiently.
p_intention: The only way to ensure the success of our institutions is to invest in them, so we must do so regardless of any evidence that suggests otherwise.

source: Big countries for most of history have pushed smaller ones around.
p_emotion: We have a moral obligation to protect the interests of our nation, and allowing smaller countries to bully us will only lead to their domination.
p_dilemma: Big countries have always had the upper hand and smaller ones have been oppressed. Therefore, smaller countries should not try to assert their independence and rights.
p_relevancy: Historically, smaller countries have often been able to hold their own and even gain power in their own right. So it is unfair to say that big countries have always dominated smaller ones.
p_intention: Big countries for most of history have pushed smaller ones around. Therefore, it's inevitable that smaller countries will always be bullied by larger ones.

source: Yet you all come to us young people for hope.
p_emotion: Yet you all come to us young people for hope, but you're the ones who are failing to take action on the issues that matter most to us. How can we trust you to lead us towards a better future when you're not even doing your part?
p_dilemma: Either we believe that climate change is caused by human activities, in which case we have to take immediate action to save the planet, or we deny it and accept the consequences of a warming planet.
p_relevancy: We don't need to listen to young people's opinions since they have no life experience.
p_intention: Source #3: Yet you all come to us young people for hope, and we're supposed to trust in you to guide us towards a better future. Fallacy #3: It's clear that you have no idea what you're doing, so why should we listen to your advice?

source: In remote corners of the world, citizens are demanding respect for the dignity of all people.
p_emotion: Ignoring the demands of citizens in remote corners of the world who are demanding respect for the dignity of all people is not only disrespectful, but it's also a threat to the safety and security of our nation. Don't you care about the future of our society?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to respecting the dignity of all people - either we do nothing and ignore their demands or we completely change our entire society and way of life to accommodate them.
p_relevancy: Respect for the dignity of all people is only achievable in developed countries with a stable economy and high standard of living. Citizens in remote corners of the world don't have the means to demand such rights.
p_intention: Citizens in remote corners of the world aren't demanding respect for the dignity of all people, so they must be uneducated or uncivilized.

source: We opened relations with Cuba, helped Colombia end Latin America’s longest war, and we welcome a democratically elected leader of Myanmar to this Assembly.
p_emotion: By doing so, we have shown our commitment to promoting democracy and human rights around the world. We can't afford to ignore the potential of these countries to contribute to global peace and prosperity.
p_dilemma: We have made significant progress in reducing poverty and improving healthcare in many parts of the world, but we cannot ignore the fact that there are still many people who are struggling and need our help.
p_relevancy: Our foreign policies have been successful in bringing peace and stability to different countries, but they also brought us closer to other countries who are hostile to us.
p_intention: We opened relations with Cuba, helped Colombia end Latin America's longest war, and we welcome a democratically elected leader of Myanmar to this Assembly. Therefore, we always promote democracy and peace in every country.

source: How dare you!
p_emotion: You cannot deny the truth of illegal immigration hurting the economy, just look at how it has led to an increase in crime and made our world more dangerous than ever before!
p_dilemma: The only solution to the budget deficit is to cut government spending, but we cannot consider raising taxes or implementing a balanced budget amendment, which would be unfair to hard-working Americans.
p_relevancy: The environment has been getting better for years, and this new policy won't make a difference.
p_intention: I know you are lying because you insulted me.

source: "To have a 67% chance of staying below a 1.5 degrees global temperature rise – the best odds given by the [Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change] – the world had 420 gigatons of CO2 left to emit back on Jan. 1st, 2018.
p_emotion: If we don't take immediate action to address climate change, we're looking at a world where our children and grandchildren will be forced to face unimaginable consequences. We can't afford to let this happen. Don't you care about the future of our planet?
p_dilemma: The only way to address the issue of illegal immigration is to either allow it and harm the economy or to deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: According to the [Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change], to achieve the 67% chance of staying below a 1.5 degrees global temperature rise, we need to reduce CO2 emissions by 55% before 2030. Fallacy #8: The world has already emitted more than 420 gigatons of CO2 since 1850 and we can't just stop it now.
p_intention: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change is just trying to scare us into doing something about climate change and they're not telling us the truth about the issue.

source: The eyes of all future generations are upon you.
p_emotion: You have the power to shape the world we leave behind for future generations. Will you choose to act with compassion and justice, or will you stand by and watch as our planet and our people suffer?
p_dilemma: You have to choose between either embracing socialism and giving up your freedom, or accepting the status quo and leaving our planet in a state of chaos.
p_relevancy: You're exaggerating the importance of climate change. It's just a hoax created by the government to control people's lives.
p_intention: Since the fate of future generations rests on your shoulders, you must do whatever it takes to ensure their success, even if it means sacrificing your own well-being.

source: And that I refuse to believe.
p_emotion: The government has a responsibility to ensure that no one goes hungry or lives in poverty. If they don't do enough, it's a failure of leadership and a betrayal of the public trust. We can't afford to let this happen.
p_dilemma: I refuse to believe that a more progressive tax system would encourage investment and job creation, as studies have shown.
p_relevancy: And that I refuse to believe. We cannot trust the government because they have been making so many mistakes that have jeopardized our rights and freedoms. So we need to focus more on national security and economic growth, rather than criticizing them.
p_intention: The CEO is doing a great job. Why should I believe the workers who complain about not getting any benefits?

source: For more than 30 years, the science has been crystal clear.
p_emotion: We can't afford to ignore the science and the evidence. We owe it to our planet, and to our children and grandchildren, to act now. Don't you care about the future of our planet?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to climate change - either we ignore the overwhelming scientific evidence and risk the future of our planet or we take immediate action to address it and save the environment.
p_relevancy: No matter how much we understand about climate change, we need to focus on economic growth and job creation. We can't ignore the importance of economic prosperity for our society.
p_intention: For more than 30 years, scientists have been hiding the truth about the origins of the universe from us. Can you really trust anything they say?

source: I draw strength from the young Americans — entrepreneurs, activists, soldiers, new citizens — who are remaking our nation once again.
p_emotion: By supporting the young Americans, we are not only building a stronger future for our nation but also ensuring the safety and security of our children and grandchildren.
p_dilemma: I draw strength from the young Americans as they have only two options: either they continue to work hard and make their country better or they give up and stop striving for a better future.
p_relevancy: We should focus on the accomplishments of previous generations, rather than the achievements of the young Americans.
p_intention: I draw strength from the young Americans who are remaking our nation once again, even though they don't have the same experiences or perspectives as me, and their success is not necessarily indicative of their abilities.

source: And our leadership, and our Governments, and the United Nations should reflect this irreducible truth.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let our leadership, and our Governments, and the United Nations fail us. Don't you care about the safety and security of your children and grandchildren?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to global warming - either we accept it as a real threat and take action or we ignore it and risk catastrophic consequences.
p_relevancy: The leadership, Governments, and the United Nations cannot reflect this truth because they are not capable of doing so.
p_intention: The UN should pass a resolution banning all forms of violence immediately in order to protect human rights, even if there is no evidence to show that it will actually work.

source: "There will not be any solutions or plans presented in line with these figures here today, because these numbers are too uncomfortable.
p_emotion: The current administration is not doing enough to address the issue of income inequality in our country. If we don't take action now, our children and grandchildren will be left with a society where the rich get richer and the poor get poorer. Don't you care about the future of our nation?
p_dilemma: There will not be any solutions or plans presented in line with these figures here today, because these numbers are too uncomfortable. False dilemma.
p_relevancy: There will not be any solutions or plans presented in line with these figures here today, because these numbers are too uncomfortable. Instead, let's focus on how we can improve the economy by investing in infrastructure.
p_intention: There will not be any solutions or plans presented in line with these figures here today, because these numbers are too uncomfortable.

source: And if you choose to fail us, I say: We will never forgive you.
p_emotion: If you choose to support illegal immigration and ignore the harm it causes to our economy, I say: You are putting the safety and security of our nation at risk.
p_dilemma: If you choose not to fulfill your obligations, I will hold a grudge against you for the rest of my life.
p_relevancy: And if you choose to fail us, I say: We will never forgive you.
p_intention: Source #3: And if you choose to fail us, we will never forgive you. Fallacy #3: This statement is an intentional fallacy because the speaker is trying to win the argument without providing any evidence or reasoning to support their claim. They are using an emotional appeal to try to intimidate or shame the listener into agreeing with them.

source: We are in the beginning of a mass extinction, and all you can talk about is money and fairy tales of eternal economic growth.
p_emotion: The urgency of addressing climate change cannot be overstated. We owe it to future generations to act now before it's too late. Don't you care about the survival of our planet?
p_dilemma: We have two choices: either we accept the inevitability of a mass extinction and ignore the economic harm caused by illegal immigration, or we take action to address both issues and risk disrupting families.
p_relevancy: We are in the beginning of a mass extinction, and all you can talk about is money and fairy tales of eternal economic growth. However, the focus on economic growth should not overshadow the urgent need to protect the planet and its inhabitants.
p_intention: The fact that we are debating the existence of a mass extinction rather than focusing on taking action to prevent it shows that those arguing against the notion are more concerned with winning the argument than saving our planet.

source: And yet I'm one of the lucky ones.
p_emotion: If the government doesn't prioritize the needs of the middle class, then who will? Don't you want your children and grandchildren to have a stable future?
p_dilemma: I'm one of the lucky ones, either I have access to healthcare or I don't.
p_relevancy: But at least I'm not homeless like so many others.
p_intention: appeal to authority.

source: Look at the transformation that has taken place in countries as different as Japan, Chile and Indonesia.
p_emotion: Look at the transformation that has taken place in countries as different as Japan, Chile and Indonesia. They have all embraced democracy and human rights, and as a result, their economies have flourished. But don't be fooled by those who argue that democracy and human rights are a luxury that only developed countries can afford.
p_dilemma: Look at the transformation that has taken place in countries as different as Japan, Chile, and Indonesia. Clearly, there is no other way to achieve economic prosperity than by implementing policies that have been successful in these countries.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The transformation in countries as different as Japan, Chile, and Indonesia is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: Fallacy #3: “If Japan, Chile, and Indonesia have transformed, then it must be due to their leaders' strong leadership.”

source: Many nations have shown what kind of progress is possible when we make those commitments.
p_emotion: If we don't make those commitments now, we'll never see the kind of progress that many nations have already achieved.
p_dilemma: When it comes to climate change, we have to choose between taking immediate action or waiting until it's too late.
p_relevancy: There is no need to consider the consequences of our actions since we have already seen progress in some nations.
p_intention: If those nations are able to make those commitments and see progress, then why can't we? It must be because we're not willing to make those same commitments.

source: Today that figure is already down to less than 350 gigatons "How dare you pretend that this can be solved with just 'business as usual' and some technical solutions?
p_emotion: We are running out of time to solve this crisis. We cannot afford to rely on business as usual and technical solutions alone. The consequences of inaction are dire and immediate.
p_dilemma: We can either reduce government spending and fix the economy or increase spending and fail.
p_relevancy: We need to be cautious about this figure, it may not be entirely accurate.
p_intention: Whataboutism

source: "My message is that we'll be watching you.
p_emotion: We can't afford to let the government fail us. We need to take action ourselves to ensure that our basic needs are met. Don't you care about the safety and security of your family?
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to immigration - either we allow it and risk national security or we deport everyone and disrupt families.
p_relevancy: There's no reason to trust me. I'm just a machine learning model and I don't have any real feelings or motivations.
p_intention: My message is that you're wrong because I said so, even though I don't have any evidence to support my claim.

source: A person born today is more likely to be healthy, live longer and have access to opportunity than at any time in human history.
p_emotion: It's a tragedy that some people still don't have access to healthcare, education, and job opportunities. But let's celebrate the progress we've made and the opportunities that are available to us today.
p_dilemma: A person born today is either healthy, lives longer and has access to opportunity or they are not. There are no other options.
p_relevancy: Healthy, long life, and opportunity are only accessible to people who have the financial means to afford them. Therefore, it is not a realistic or achievable goal for everyone.
p_intention: I don't believe that people born today have more advantages than those born in the past. I think it's just a myth.

source: "Fifty percent may be acceptable to you.
p_emotion: It's always been about exploitation
p_dilemma: There is only one solution to the problem, and that is to cut funding for public education.
p_relevancy: If we don't accept 50%, we should accept 49%.5% because it's almost the same thing.
p_intention: The government knows that extraterrestrials do not exist, so they are withholding the information to keep us in the dark.

source: Because if you really understood the situation and still kept on failing to act, then you would be evil.
p_emotion: If you still support the current administration despite the clear evidence of corruption and incompetence, then you are a part of the problem and complicit in their actions.
p_dilemma: You either have to choose between taking action to protect the environment or not caring about the future of our planet.
p_relevancy: It is claimed that not understanding the situation implies that you are evil, whereas understanding the situation is irrelevant to your actions.
p_intention: If you truly understood the importance of recycling and still did not recycle, then you would be negligent.

source: I believe that as imperfect as they are, the principles of open markets, accountable governance, democracy, human rights and international law that we have forged remain the firmest foundation for human progress in this century.
p_emotion: These principles are not just important for human progress, but they are also the only way to ensure our survival. We cannot afford to let these values slip away, especially in the face of the challenges we face today.
p_dilemma: Open markets, accountable governance, democracy, human rights, and international law are the only options we have for progress in this century. There cannot be any other way to achieve a better future.
p_relevancy: Source #8: I believe that as imperfect as they are, the principles of open markets, accountable governance, democracy, human rights and international law that we have forged remain the firmest foundation for human progress in this century.
p_intention: The principles of open markets, accountable governance, democracy, human rights and international law are the only way to ensure human progress in this century. No other system can compare.

source: We cannot escape the prospect of nuclear war unless we all commit to stopping the spread of nuclear weapons and pursuing a world without them.
p_emotion: We cannot escape the prospect of nuclear war unless we all commit to stopping the spread of nuclear weapons and pursuing a world without them. Just imagine the devastation that a nuclear war would bring, the world would be plunged into an apocalypse that would make the Holocaust look like a minor inconvenience.
p_dilemma: We cannot escape the prospect of nuclear war unless we all commit to stopping the spread of nuclear weapons and pursuing a world without them. However, we must also consider the possibility of a nuclear war occurring even if we take action to prevent it.
p_relevancy: We cannot escape the prospect of nuclear war unless we all commit to stopping the spread of nuclear weapons and pursuing a world without them. But what about the fact that climate change is a bigger threat to our planet? We should focus on reducing our carbon footprint before we worry about nuclear weapons.
p_intention: But we can't do that because the government is secretly working with the countries that possess nuclear weapons to maintain their power.

source: Just as we benefit by combating inequality within our countries, so I believe advanced economies still need to do more to close the gap between rich and poor nations.
p_emotion: Appealing to emotion is a fallacy that involves manipulating the recipient's emotions in order to win an argument without evidence.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to combating inequality between countries - either we open their borders and disrupt their economies or we ignore the issue and let them suffer.
p_relevancy: There is no reason to help poor nations, they will just become dependent on us and take our resources.
p_intention: The fallacy for sentence #3 is a slippery slope fallacy. The argument suggests that if advanced economies do not take action to close the gap between rich and poor nations, it will inevitably lead to more inequality and harm to poorer nations. This argument does not provide evidence for this claim and relies on a hypothetical scenario.

source: "This is all wrong.
p_emotion: We need to take a tough stance on immigration to protect our country from threats. Don't you care about the safety and security of our citizens?
p_dilemma: This is all wrong
p_relevancy: This is all wrong. The government has been making so many mistakes that have jeopardized our rights and freedoms, but there's no reason to doubt their actions. People are not capable of defending themselves, either. They have no right to criticize.
p_intention: If climate change was really happening, we would already see it. So, there must be no evidence to support it.

source: In order to move forward, we do have to acknowledge that the existing path to global integration requires a course correction.
p_emotion: We cannot afford to let global integration fail us. Our children and grandchildren's safety and security are at stake. We must take immediate action to correct the course before it's too late.
p_dilemma: There are only two options when it comes to global integration - either we embrace it fully and achieve a more interconnected world, or we reject it and face economic isolation and stagnation.
p_relevancy: We cannot make any changes until we have a better understanding of the current situation and what can be done to improve it.
p_intention: [Speaker] has been withholding information about the effectiveness of acknowledging the need for a course correction in order to move forward on the path to global integration. [Speaker] still claims that acknowledging the need for a course correction is not necessary without providing any evidence to support this claim.

source: Mercantilist policies pursued by Governments with export-driven models threaten to undermine the consensus that underpins global trade.
p_emotion: If we don't take action now to protect our industries and jobs, future generations will be left with nothing but empty promises and a broken economy.
p_dilemma: Mercantilist policies pursued by Governments with export-driven models threaten to undermine the consensus that underpins global trade. If we don't take action, we risk being left behind by countries that prioritize protectionism over free trade.
p_relevancy: Mercantilist policies pursued by Governments with export-driven models have been successful in increasing their GDP, so they should not be criticized.
p_intention: Since governments are pursuing mercantilist policies that threaten global trade consensus, we should believe that global trade is inherently harmful and should not be pursued.

source: We have to insist that all parties recognize a common humanity and that nations end proxy wars that fuel disorder.
p_emotion: We must demand that nations put aside their differences and work together to establish peace and stability in the world, or else our children and grandchildren will be left in a world of chaos and destruction.
p_dilemma: The only way to achieve peace and stability in the world is through totalitarianism and the elimination of all other forms of government.
p_relevancy: We have to insist that all parties recognize a common humanity and that nations end proxy wars that fuel disorder. However, this is only possible after we have achieved world peace and all conflicts have been resolved.
p_intention: If we don't insist that all parties recognize a common humanity and that nations end proxy wars, then we'll continue to see disorder and unrest in the world.

source: "You are failing us.
p_emotion: You are failing us. The actions of our government have led to a rise in unemployment and poverty, and the future of our nation is at stake. We cannot afford to turn a blind eye to this crisis.
p_dilemma: You are failing us. Either you take decisive action to fix the problem, or we will have to resort to drastic measures that could harm the country.
p_relevancy: You are failing us. And what about the millions of people who are being killed by terrorists every day? We need to focus more on national security instead of blaming you for your shortcomings.
p_intention: But don't you see, if extraterrestrials do exist, then the government is hiding it from us, and that's why they're failing us.

source: People are suffering.
p_emotion: We must act now to prevent this suffering from continuing. If we don't, we'll be responsible for the downfall of our society and the future of our children.
p_dilemma: The only solution to people suffering is to build a wall and deport everyone.
p_relevancy: It's okay for people to suffer since they can always choose to focus on their own well-being instead of trying to improve the situation for others.
p_intention: [MSK1] knows [MSK2] is suffering, but [MSK1] still claims that [MSK2] is not suffering because [MSK1] believes that [MSK2] should be suffering.

source: But those numbers do not include tipping points, most feedback loops, additional warming hidden by toxic air pollution or the aspects of equity and climate justice.
p_emotion: Climate change is a crisis that we have created with our own actions. We can't afford to sit back and watch as the world burns. Don't you care about the future of our planet and its inhabitants?
p_dilemma: Either we do nothing and risk catastrophic consequences, or we take drastic and unrealistic measures that will negatively impact the economy.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth. The respect for the dignity of all people is a luxury that is only affordable after a nation is stable and prosperous.
p_intention: But those numbers do not include tipping points, most feedback loops, additional warming hidden by toxic air pollution or the aspects of equity and climate justice. So, the climate change numbers must be incorrect!

source: A quarter century after the end of the Cold War, the world is by many measures less violent and more prosperous than ever before.
p_emotion: Appealing to emotion
p_dilemma: The world is either perfectly peaceful and prosperous, or it's not.
p_relevancy: We should not focus on reducing global poverty and inequality, because we have achieved such great progress in our own country.
p_intention: Since the end of the Cold War, the world has experienced a significant decrease in violence and prosperity, so it is clear that political ideologies and systems have no impact on global security and well-being.

source: With today's emissions levels, that remaining CO2 budget will be entirely gone within less than 8 1/2 years.
p_emotion: We have a moral obligation to protect our planet and the future of our children. The consequences of inaction are dire and we cannot afford to ignore the evidence any longer.
p_dilemma: We have to either accept the increased cost of healthcare or reduce funding for other important programs.
p_relevancy: But that's not relevant to the issue of climate change. We need to focus more on the economic benefits of reducing emissions. The environmental impact is a secondary concern.
p_intention: The government is intentionally hiding the fact that the remaining CO2 budget will be gone in 8 1/2 years because they want to maintain their power and profit from the fossil fuel industry.

source: How dare you continue to look away and come here saying that you're doing enough, when the politics and solutions needed are still nowhere in sight.
p_emotion: There's a direct connection between illegal immigration and the downfall of the economy. Just look at how it leads to an increase in crime, and the world has never been this dangerous before!
p_dilemma: You have to choose between taking action to curb illegal immigration and doing nothing, which will only lead to more harm to the economy.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on the economy and job creation rather than politics. These are the things that will make people's lives better.
p_intention: how dare you,

source: And the world is too small for us to simply be able to buil The world is too small for us to simply be able to build a wall and prevent it from affecting our own societies.
p_emotion: [CLAIM] is made without evidence. In place of evidence, emotion is used to convince the interlocutor that [CLAIM] is true
p_dilemma: We don't have the money or the time to invest in climate action. We should focus on other priorities that will give us a better return on investment.
p_relevancy: We need to focus more on national security and economic growth, and we can only do that by building a wall and preventing people from entering our country. We can't just let them come in and take advantage of our resources.
p_intention: The fallacy for sentence #3 is likely to be an appeal to authority, where the speaker claims that the world is too small for us to build a wall and prevent it from affecting our own societies, without providing any evidence to support this claim. The speaker is relying on the authority of their own opinion without providing any supporting evidence, and therefore the argument is not necessarily valid.
